title: How to Make a Greeting Card Envelope

steps.title: Lay your card
steps.content: Lay your card on a piece of 8 1/2 x 11 paper. Center it horizontally on the paper but a little low. [1] X Research source If you don't have a card already, just mark the paper where you want your card to be.

steps.title: Fold the sides of the paper
steps.content: Fold the sides of the paper inwards. Leave a little room so the envelope will be a little larger than the card. [2] X Research source Press firmly on the edge of each fold so it lays down flat. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Do the same with the top
steps.content: Do the same with the top and the bottom (remembering to leave a little wiggle room).

steps.title: Now flatten out the paper and remove the card.
steps.content: Now flatten out the paper and remove the card.

steps.title: Snip off the corners.
steps.content: Snip off the corners. Make a cut slightly larger than 90 degrees. [4] X Research source One corner snipped off.

steps.title: Do this for all four corners.
steps.content: Do this for all four corners.

steps.title: Check that the card will fit inside just nicely (always best to check this before you glue).
steps.content: Check that the card will fit inside just nicely (always best to check this before you glue).

steps.title: Put just a little dab of glue
steps.content: Put just a little dab of glue at the bottom of each side piece. Then fold the bottom up and press down (this glues the bottom piece on to the sides).

steps.title: Measure and cut a new piece of paper
steps.content: Measure and cut a new piece of paper slightly smaller than your envelope. This will be the back piece.

steps.title: Glue carefully along the sides and bottom of the envelope,
steps.content: Glue carefully along the sides and bottom of the envelope, then place the back piece on and press down gently.

steps.title: There you have it
steps.content: There you have it - the finished envelope! Put the card inside, then glue the top of the envelope closed.
